我为何返回学术界

一点非学术的杂想

May 19, 2024

My only love sprung from my only hate!

Too early seen unknown, and known too late!

Prodigious birth of love it is to me,

That I must love a loathed enemy.

—Romeo and Juliet : I.v.142–145

最近做出了一个并不轻松的选择——决定辞去开始不到两年的工业界工作，以普通博士后身份重返大学，继续基础研究。

还有离开了学习工作九年的新英格兰，独闯人文环境和生活方式迥异的西部世界


一

问题—Is it still fun to do science?

Madame, vous voyez la science de haut, comme une vaste tapisserie. Je la vois d’en bas, au niveau du petit point.

↪ Madam, you look at science from the top and see it as a vast tapestry. I look at it from the bottom and notice every single stitch.

—Pierre-Gilles de Gennes, Petit point


Я верю в их святую веру.

Их вера — мужество мое.

Я делаю себе карьеру

тем, что не делаю ее!

↪  I believe in their holy belief.

From their belief my courage is won.

I shall pursue a career for myself

by not pursuing one!

—Евгений Евтушенко, Карьера


He’s sitting there, away from the madding crowd that’s stampeding up and down the aisle and, actually, he’s trying to isolate himself because, in fact, shortly he will be isolated for a long period of time in the lonely north.

—Glenn Gould, The Idea of North


It is the glistening and softly spoken lie; the amiable fallacy; the patriotic lie of the historian, the provident lie of the politician, the zealous lie of the partizan, the merciful lie of the friend, and the careless lie of each man to himself, that cast that black mystery over humanity, through which any man who pierces, we thank as we would thank one who dug a well in a desert.

—John Ruskin, The Seven Lamps of Architecture
